metadata.Title: CVE-2020-26147 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel 5.8.9. The WEP, WPA, WPA2, andWPA3 implementations reassemble fragments even though some of them weresent in plaintext. This vulnerability can be abused to inject packetsand/or exfiltrate selected fragments when another device sends fragmentedframes and the WEP, CCMP, or GCMP data-confidentiality protocol is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-26147` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-generic - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-219-lowlatency - 4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1099-aws - 4.4.0-1099.104
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1121-azure - 4.15.0-1121.134~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
linux-lts-xenial package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-219.252~14.04.1').
linux-aws package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1099.104').
linux-azure package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1121.134~14.04.1').
